citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The female Bactrian camel was observed walking in an abnormal circular pattern for an extended period at the front of the
enclosure near the guests. During her walk, she would repeatedly lift her head at the same place in her walk when she
circled to the right. The facility noticed that she recently started walking in this circular pattern and attributed it to work
around her enclosure and unwanted attention from the male. Although the facility is aware of the new abnormal behavior,
they have not communicated it to their veterinarian in order to determine if there are any underlying causes or discussed a
plan to mitigate the behavior. When sudden changes in behavior like this occur, it should be communicated in a timely
manner to the veterinarian for guidance and a potential treatment plan.
Correct by: June 28, 2023

An employee was not present at the giraffe feeding station in the drive through park where guests were directed to park
their cars if they wished to feed the giraffes. The inspector observed a car stop and instead of following park directions to
place food outside the vehicle, the giraffe was observed reaching its head into the vehicle on the passenger side. This
feeding situation creates a potential safety risk to the giraffe. The facility must have an employee present at all times to
assure the guests are following the parks guidance, and feed the giraffe in an appropriate manner for their safety.
Correct by: June 27, 2023

The metal for the shift door in the lynx holding area is broken, with a section of the metal track missing. This track needs
to be replaced to keep the door in good repair and working condition for the safety of the animals when shifting occurs.
This item was corrected prior to the end of inspection the 2nd day but the facility needs to have a process in place for
identifying and correcting facility issues in a timely manner.
Correct by: June 30, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the owner and general curator of the park.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The female Bactrian camel was observed walking in an abnormal circular pattern for an extended period at the front of the 
enclosure near the guests. During her walk, she would repeatedly lift her head at the same place in her walk when she 
circled to the right. The facility noticed that she recently started walking in this circular pattern and attributed it to work 
around her enclosure and unwanted attention from the male. Although the facility is aware of the new abnormal behavior, 
they have not communicated it to their veterinarian in order to determine if there are any underlying causes or discussed a 
plan to mitigate the behavior. When sudden changes in behavior like this occur, it should be communicated in a timely 
manner to the veterinarian for guidance and a potential treatment plan.  
Correct by: June 28, 2023 
2.131(d)(2) 
   
Handling of animals. 
An employee was not present at the giraffe feeding station in the drive through park where guests were directed to park 
their cars if they wished to feed the giraffes. The inspector observed a car stop and instead of following park directions to 
place food outside the vehicle, the giraffe was observed reaching its head into the vehicle on the passenger side. This 
feeding situation creates a potential safety risk to the giraffe. The facility must have an employee present at all times to 
assure the guests are following the parks guidance, and feed the giraffe in an appropriate manner for their safety.  
Correct by: June 27, 2023 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The metal for the shift door in the lynx holding area is broken, with a section of the metal track missing. This track needs 
to be replaced to keep the door in good repair and working condition for the safety of the animals when shifting occurs. 
This item was corrected prior to the end of inspection the 2nd day but the facility needs to have a process in place for 
identifying and correcting facility issues in a timely manner.  
Correct by: June 30, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the owner and general curator of the park.
